(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.)

Address: 2375 Ross St., Regina, Sask.
Birthplace: Humboldt, Manitoba, Can.

1. INTRODUCTION

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1891
Where did you set up housekeeping? Regina, Saskatchewan
How many people did you prepare meals? 4
How far was it to your nearest store? Battleford
How often could a visit be made to the store? Twice a week
What groceries did you usually buy in those earlier years? Staples only

Flour, sugar, white flour, bacon, butter, coffee, tea, salt.

After 1895 Mr. Matheson began buying the farm supply & groceries in Edmonton where he built farms and floated them down the Saskatchewan River in June each year. In 1892 we began taking Indian children into our home and in a few years our number increased to 60 which made it necessary to have teachers and helpers for all the work detailed.

After 1903 Chipman was started so we could augment our supplies there as necessary but Mr. Matheson continued to bring down our yearly supply on scows until 1911.
